Entry.JapaneseText: [VARIABLE]
Entry.EnglishText: [VARIABLE]

Entry.JapaneseText: select
Entry.EnglishText: Select

Entry.JapaneseText: 道具屋「風の羽」
Entry.EnglishText: Item Shop

Entry.JapaneseText: 装備品屋「鋭きくちばし」
Entry.EnglishText: Weapon Shop

Entry.JapaneseText: ピピスタ
Entry.EnglishText: Pipista

Entry.JapaneseText: ピピスタ・道具屋・装備品屋
Entry.EnglishText: Pipista - Item Shop - Weapon Shop

Entry.JapaneseText: 道具屋・装備品屋
Entry.EnglishText: Item Shop - Weapon Shop

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0><scale:140>休憩しますか？ はい いいえ
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0><scale:140>Would you like to rest? Yes No

Entry.JapaneseText: じ、地面が揺れてるわ……！ ど、どうなってるの!?
Entry.EnglishText: T-The gound is shaking... Wh-What's going on!?

Entry.JapaneseText: ゆっくり見ていって。
Entry.EnglishText: Take your time and look around.

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒュ、ヒューマが…… 何か……？
Entry.EnglishText: A H-Huma... What on earth...?
Entry.Notes: want it checked. Thinking maybe it's like: "A Huma is here? Why?" -Dragon need context -Mine

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0><scale:140> 道具を買う 装飾品を買う 世間話をする やめる
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0><scale:140>Buy Items Buy Accessories Talk Cancel

Entry.JapaneseText: また来てくださいね。
Entry.EnglishText: Come back again!

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒューマと話しちゃった……
Entry.EnglishText: I spoke with a Huma...

Entry.JapaneseText: 道具はこちらになります。
Entry.EnglishText: All your necessities can be found right here.

Entry.JapaneseText: また今度来てください。
Entry.EnglishText: Come back again.

Entry.JapaneseText: ど、道具がほしいの？ あ、あるけど……
Entry.EnglishText: D-Did you want some items? I-I have some here...

Entry.JapaneseText: ど、どうも……
Entry.EnglishText: H-Hello there...

Entry.JapaneseText: 装飾品はこちらです。
Entry.EnglishText: Here are the accessories.

Entry.JapaneseText: また今度来てください。
Entry.EnglishText: Please come again.

Entry.JapaneseText: そ、装飾品がほしいの？ な、ない事はないけど……
Entry.EnglishText: D-Do you want accessories? N-Not saying I don't have any, but...

Entry.JapaneseText: ま、また……来るの？
Entry.EnglishText: Y-You're coming back...again?

Entry.JapaneseText: ドバル様に 失礼のないように。
Entry.EnglishText: Please don't show any disrespect to Chief Doval.

Entry.JapaneseText: 何といっても<Red>特等民<White>の中の <Red>特等民<White>、酋長ですからね。
Entry.EnglishText: He ranks among the <Red>Superior Citizens<White>, given that he is our chief, after all.

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒュ、ヒューマが、 ドバル様の顔を拝めるだけでも あ、ありがたい事……よ。
Entry.EnglishText: S-So you H-Huma only want to see Chief Doval. Oh, thank goodness...

Entry.JapaneseText: 騒がしいわね…… まったく…… 下等な人たちは困るわ……
Entry.EnglishText: You're making quite a disturbance... Jeez, we can't have you lowlifes here...

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒュ、ヒューマなんて 肌はノッペリ、羽も角もない 下の下の下の劣等種……だわ。
Entry.EnglishText: H-Huma have smooth skin and don't even have any feathers or horns. They truly are the lowest of the low, the Inferior race.

Entry.JapaneseText: 子供がいなくなった ですって？
Entry.EnglishText: The children went missing, you say!?

Entry.JapaneseText: この辺りで行くとしたら…… 砂漠しかないし、地上絵でも 見にいったのかしら……？
Entry.EnglishText: Well, we're surrounded by nothing but desert, but maybe they went to look at the geoglyph?

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒュ、ヒューマが来ると、 いつも面倒な事が…… お、起きるのよ……
Entry.EnglishText: W-Why is it that whenever H-Huma come, something t-troublesome happens...?

Entry.JapaneseText: 見つかってよかったわ。 最近はヒューマもウロウロしてて、 危険だものね。
Entry.EnglishText: I'm glad you found them. It's been a lot more dangerous lately with all these Huma around.

Entry.JapaneseText: あなたの連れのヒューマは 何もしないでしょうね……？
Entry.EnglishText: Your Huma companions haven't done anything in the village, right...?

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒュ、ヒューマなんかに 感謝なんて……しないわよ……
Entry.EnglishText: I-I refuse to give thanks to a Huma...

Entry.JapaneseText: ……あなた、トッポとレイを 連れ帰って来た……
Entry.EnglishText: You guys... You brought back Topp and Rei.

Entry.JapaneseText: ……あなたの連れも、 少しは役に立ったのかしらね。
Entry.EnglishText: ...Were your companions of any use?

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒュ、ヒューマがガジュマを 助けるなんて……どんな…… 下心があるの……かしら？
Entry.EnglishText: A H-Huma helping out a Gajuma... Wh-What sort of ulterior motive do they have...?

Entry.JapaneseText: この村は、どうなるのかしら？ 階級は、とりあえず取り消しに なったけど……
Entry.EnglishText: What will happen to our village? The social class system has been dismantled for now, but...

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒュ、ヒューマと話すと…… あれこれ困っちゃうのよ…… 声、かけないで……
Entry.EnglishText: I-I have a lot of trouble whenever... I have to s-speak to a H-Huma... P-Please don't bother me.

Entry.JapaneseText: 協力、して……生きるしか、 ないのかもしれないわね…… ガジュマも、ヒューマも……
Entry.EnglishText: Maybe we have to cooperate and live side by side... Both Gajuma and Huma, together.

Entry.JapaneseText: 私ね、この街から、 ほとんど出た事がないの。
Entry.EnglishText: I have hardly ever left this village.

Entry.JapaneseText: たまには旅行に行ってみたいけど、 外にはヒューマもいるし……
Entry.EnglishText: I would've loved to travel every now and then, but there are Huma out there...

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒュ、ヒューマとあまり 話したくないの……
Entry.EnglishText: I-I don't want to speak with H-Huma more than I need to...

Entry.JapaneseText: ……というより、怖いの。 見慣れなくて……
Entry.EnglishText: ...Or rather, it's scary. I'm not used to it.

Entry.JapaneseText: な、何なのこの音…… すごく近くから聞こえるわ！
Entry.EnglishText: Wh-What's that sound...? It feels like it's super close by!

Entry.JapaneseText: いらっしゃいませ。
Entry.EnglishText: Welcome.

Entry.JapaneseText: ……なに、かしら？
Entry.EnglishText: ...Do you need something?

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0><scale:140> 武器を買う 防具を買う 世間話をする やめる
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0><scale:140>Buy Weapons Buy Armor Talk Cancel

Entry.JapaneseText: いつでもどうぞー。
Entry.EnglishText: Please come by anytime.

Entry.JapaneseText: また……どうぞ？
Entry.EnglishText: Come...again...?

Entry.JapaneseText: 見るだけはタダ。 気に入ったら買っておくれ。
Entry.EnglishText: Looking's free and all. Feel free to come buy if something catches your eye.

Entry.JapaneseText: また来ておくれよ。 いつでも見るだけはタダだよ。
Entry.EnglishText: Come back anytime. There's no fee for window-shopping.

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒューマ向けの品がないって 思われちゃ困るからね……
Entry.EnglishText: I don't want people thinking we don't stock goods for Huma...

Entry.JapaneseText: ムリして来なくていいから。
Entry.EnglishText: You don't have to force yourself to come here.

Entry.JapaneseText: 見るだけはタダ。 気に入ったら買っておくれ。
Entry.EnglishText: Looking's free and all. Feel free to come buy if something catches your eye.

Entry.JapaneseText: 近いうちに新しい武器が 入荷する予定なのよ。 また見に来てね。
Entry.EnglishText: We'll have new weapons in stock soon. Please come back again to take a look.

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒューマ向けの品がないって 思われちゃ困るからね……
Entry.EnglishText: I don't want people thinking we don't stock goods for Huma...

Entry.JapaneseText: 近々、新しい商品も入荷する 予定があるけど…… ムリして来なくていいから。
Entry.EnglishText: We'll have some new products coming in soon, but...don't bother coming back.

Entry.JapaneseText: 見るだけはタダ。 気に入ったら買っておくれ。
Entry.EnglishText: Looking's free and all. Feel free to come buy if something catches your eye.

Entry.JapaneseText: またどうぞ。
Entry.EnglishText: Please come again.

Entry.JapaneseText: 備えあれば憂いなし！ さあ、買った買った！
Entry.EnglishText: Bid your sorrows goodbye by preparing! So go ahead and buy, buy, buy!

Entry.JapaneseText: 今、新商品の入荷を検討中なの。 また見に来てちょうだい。
Entry.EnglishText: I've been working on getting some new items in stock. Please come back again to take a look.

Entry.JapaneseText: 道中気をつけて！
Entry.EnglishText: Take care on the road!

Entry.JapaneseText: また、どうぞ……？
Entry.EnglishText: Please come again...?

Entry.JapaneseText: また、どうぞ……？
Entry.EnglishText: Please come again...?

Entry.JapaneseText: ここは、ガジュマの 村なんだけどね……
Entry.EnglishText: This is a Gajuma village...

Entry.JapaneseText: 私は前々から思っていたのよ。 同じガジュマといっても、 色々あるってね……
Entry.EnglishText: I've been thinking about this for a while, but even though we're all called Gajuma, there are so many different kinds among us.

Entry.JapaneseText: ようやくドバル様も、その事に 気づいてくださったわ……
Entry.EnglishText: Chief Doval has finally recognized these differences...

Entry.JapaneseText: 本当は<Red>劣等民<White>の ヒューマなんかには、 売りたくないんだけどね。
Entry.EnglishText: Truth be told, I don't really want to sell to any <Red>Inferior<White> Huma, but...

Entry.JapaneseText: こっちは商売だしさ……
Entry.EnglishText: We are a business, so...

Entry.JapaneseText: 最近、何かとケンカがあるけど、 これもヒューマに対抗するため。
Entry.EnglishText: There's been a lot of infighting lately, but it's all to counter the Huma threat.

Entry.JapaneseText: <Red>ニ等民<White>には 我慢してもらわなきゃね。
Entry.EnglishText: The <Red>Lesser Citizens<White> will just have to be patient.

Entry.JapaneseText: このピピスタはドバル様の下、 強固な身分制度で団結したんだ。
Entry.EnglishText: Chief Doval has united Pipista with a firm social class system.

Entry.JapaneseText: あんたら、ヒューマなんて もう怖くないね。
Entry.EnglishText: You Huma don't scare me anymore.

Entry.JapaneseText: ちょっと子供が帰ってこないくらいで あんな大騒ぎしなくてもねぇ…… その辺で遊んでるだけだよ。
Entry.EnglishText: You guys don't need to make such a huge fuss over some kids not returning home for a bit... They probably went to play nearby.

Entry.JapaneseText: 問題なのは、階級が違う者が 一緒に遊んでるって事さね……
Entry.EnglishText: The real problem is children from different classes playing together...

Entry.JapaneseText: あんたら、ヒューマが 探しに行くだって？ フン、勝手におしよ！
Entry.EnglishText: You say that you Huma are gonna look for those kids? Fine, go and waste your time!

Entry.JapaneseText: 本当に、人騒がせな 子供らだよ……
Entry.EnglishText: You're just overreacting, they're just kids...

Entry.JapaneseText: 大人が決めたルールが、 そんなに気に入らないのかねぇ。 反抗期なのかもしれないね。
Entry.EnglishText: I wonder if those kids just don't like the rules we adults set. Could be that they're just being rebellious.

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒューマには、私たちの村に 首を突っ込んでほしかないね。
Entry.EnglishText: I don't want some Huma sticking their noses into this village's affairs.

Entry.JapaneseText: あんた、何だってヒューマと 一緒にいるんだい…… 気持ち悪くないかい？
Entry.EnglishText: What are you doing together with a bunch of Huma? Does it not bother you?

Entry.JapaneseText: ……ヒューマとは話したくないね。 ガジュマには心ってもんが あるんだからね！
Entry.EnglishText: ...I don't want to talk with you Huma at all. We Gajuma all have hearts, you know!

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒューマと協力なんて、 本当にできると思うかい？
Entry.EnglishText: Do you really think you can work together with Huma?

Entry.JapaneseText: 何十年も生きてきて、 ほとんど何もヒューマの事を 知らないんだよ。
Entry.EnglishText: I've lived for decades, yet I know almost nothing about Huma.

Entry.JapaneseText: ……何の用だい？ ヒューマとムダ話するほど、 ヒマじゃないよ。
Entry.EnglishText: ...What do you want? I don't have time to waste talking to some Huma.

Entry.JapaneseText: 最近、村から緊張感みたいな ものがなくなってきたよ。 これはこれで、暮らしやすいね。
Entry.EnglishText: There hasn't been any tension in the village as of late. It's made life a lot easier.

Entry.JapaneseText: ……何だい…… 少しくらいならヒューマの話も…… 聞いてやらない事もないよ？
Entry.EnglishText: ...What do you want? I might be able to listen to what a Huma has to say...for a little bit.

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒューマと一緒に歩いてる ガジュマなんて珍しいね。
Entry.EnglishText: It's rare to see a Gajuma walking around with a Huma.

Entry.JapaneseText: 大丈夫かい？ ヒューマくさくないのかい？
Entry.EnglishText: Is your head on straight? How could you associate with those filthy Huma?

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒューマってのは、 欲深くて困るわ。
Entry.EnglishText: Huma greed knows no bounds. Truly a troublesome bunch.

Entry.JapaneseText: うちは１ガルドたりとも オマケしないからね。
Entry.EnglishText: I refuse to give you any discounts. ...Not even by a single Gald.

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『ピピスタのみやげもの』 鳥を模した置物や、小物、 ピピスタの昔話の本などが 並んでいる。 「店員のおすすめ 秘密」
Entry.EnglishText:
<speed:0>- Pipista's Souvenirs - Ornaments of birds, trinkets, and books on Pipista's folktales are all lined up.
The Shopkeeper's Recommendation: Secrecy

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『ピピスタのみやげもの』 ツルベナ荒野の地上絵のポスターや 石を削って作った置物などが 並んでいる。 「ドバル酋長のおすすめ 重石」
Entry.EnglishText:
<speed:0>- Pipista's Souvenirs - There are posters depicting the Crvena Wasteland's geoglyphs and stone figurines displayed together.
Chief Doval's Recommendation: Stone Weights

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『湿原情景』 ゼレン湿原の風景を墨で描いた絵。 荒々しい筆致の中に 細密な線も織り込まれている。 湿原の情景がなまなましく表れている。
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>- Wetland Scenery - An ink painting of the scenery of the Zeren Wetlands Spring. Detailed brushstrokes are interwoven with rougher strokes. The scenery of the wetlands feels vividly alive.

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『鳥の木の柱』 店の入口に置かれているものと同じもの。 死者は鳥になるという考えのもと、 先祖を慰霊するために建てられる。
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>- Bird Tree Pillar - It's the same as the one at the entrance of the store. These were erected to honor one's ancestors, following the belief that the deceased would become birds.

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『ピピスタのみやげもの』 鳥の羽を使った魔よけのお守りや 鳥のクチバシの形の置物などと いった、工芸品が並んでいる。 「店長のおすすめ ミニ・鳥柱」
Entry.EnglishText:
<speed:0>- Pipista's Souvenirs - This section offers various handicrafts, such as amulets with bird feathers to ward evil spirits and accessories shaped like a bird's beak.
Manager's Recommendation: Miniature Bird Pillar
